WATER.NAME: Distilled Water
WATER.NOTES: Neutral water. May be used as a base for creating desired water profile.

WATER.NAME: Burton Upon Trent, England
WATER.NOTES: Burton upon Trent is known for water with very high sulfate content. The very hard water accentuates the hops flavor. It is known for distinctive, strongly hopped pale ales.

WATER.NAME: Edinburgh, Scotland
WATER.NOTES: Because of its geology scottish brewers have access to many different waters depending on where and how deep a well is drilled. This particular profile is well suited for darker scottish ales.

WATER.NAME: London, England
WATER.NOTES: With its high temporary hardness the London water profile is well suited for dark beers like Porter. This profile has been taken from an average London water report and also matches the historic London profile found in various literature sources.

WATER.NAME: Pilsen, Czech Republic
WATER.NOTES: This very low mineral water is the traditional water for Bohemian pilsner beers. Despite its low calcium content, great pilsner and Helles style beers can be brewed with it.
